SENT.plain: The capacity of three B-lymphocyte cell lines to generate superoxide (O2.-) was examined

The Burkitt lymphoma lines P.3HR-1 and Jijoye gave no response to phorbol 12-myristate 13-acetate (PMA) at 100 ng/ml but produced up to 0.35 nmol of O2.-/min per mg of protein when stimulated with 5 micrograms of PMA/ml; the cell line RPMI 1788 produced Nitro Blue Tetrazolium-positive responses to low PMA concentrations and approx
0.4 nmol of O2.-/min per mg of protein at 5 micrograms of PMA/ml
10 pmol of low-potential cytochrome b (cytochrome b-245)/mg of protein
Homogenates of PMA-activated cells gave 10-20-fold greater rates of O2.- produced per mg of protein
The Km for NADPH varied between approx
250 microM for P3.HR-1 and RPMI 1788 cell lines and 30.5 +/- 6.5 microM for the Jijoye cell line; the Km values for NADH were higher
Determination of intracellular NADPH concentration showed that this might limit the rate of O2.- production since in each cell line it was at or below the Km concentration
